data.title: Germany
data.meta_description: Everything you need to know about mein hosts, from the Guardian guide.
data.text:
The cliché

Efficient and disciplined. You can never write off the Germans.

The reality

German invincibility has taken a pounding in the past five years, with England, Romania and Italy all handing out the sort of thrashings that would have been inconceivable in the past. A shortage of talent means heavy reliance on Michael Ballack and the team have tried 14 different defenders in the past 18 months without improvement. Still as they showed in Korea/Japan you can, er, never write them off.

Where they're staying

Schloss Hotel im Grunewald. A luxurious Berlin mansion recently renovated under the supervision of pony-tailed fashion guru Karl Lagerfeld. As well as the usual delights, the Schloss boasts a "technology butler" - surely enough on its own to distract the boys from Berlin's prodigious club scene.

Grudge match

Frank Rijkaard's spit dribbling from Rudi Völler's bubble perm and Ronald Koeman claiming to have wiped his bum with Olaf Thon's shirt has fuelled a sense of German grievance with Holland.

The politics

Oliver Kahn and Jens Lehmann are locked in a ferocious battle of egos and have not attended squad sessions together for more than a year because of fears that they would poison the atmosphere. Now Lehmann is first choice, Kahn claims he "will not wish him an injury or red card". Yeah, right.

Supported by

Thousands of men with big moustaches dressed in denim waistcoats covered in club patches and badges will lend a Status Quo concert air to games.

Slogan on team coach

"We are football"

The coach: Jürgen Klinsmann

On his chalkboard

Jürgen Klinsmann has brought a New Age approach to coaching Germany with psychological training, a laid-back attitude to discipline and some US fitness coaches who he claims will increase the team's stamina by 30%. The former Spurs striker emphasises "positivity". Just as well, because the defence is a shambles.

In his closet

Klinsi once threatened to quit playing in protest at environmental damage. He now commutes by aeroplane from California.

The players

Most likely to move to Bolton

Bernd Schneider. The John Hegley look-alike from Bayer Leverkusen has the midfield skills and, at 32, the heavy legs to find favour with those Trotters still pining for the days when Fredi Bobic saved them from relegation.

Oscar nominee

Michael Ballack normally tops the poll of Schwalbenkonig (diving-kings) though, when Franz Beckenbauer said play-actors ruined the Bundesliga, he didn't mention the Bayern Munich star. Odd that.

King of the endorsements

Kahn is top man thanks to a major deal with Burger King and TV adverts for the Paulaner Brewery that see him supping a vast flagon of lager in a Munich beer garden, but Lukas Podolski is catching up thanks to his hunky appearance in a deodorant ad.

You'll be copying . . .

The salmon-like leaping of Miroslav Klose, who out jumps defenders as if he's on a pogo stick and then skies his header over the bar.

Nation sweating on

Sebastian Kehl is hardly a household name, possibly not even in his own gaff, but Germans, having already lost the luckless Sebastian Diesler, will be hoping he recovers from an ankle injury.

Rooney to have a grand on

Superfast midfielder David Odonkor outsprinting Theo Walcott over 100m (his PB for the distance is 10.9sec).

If they were shoes . . . Hush Puppies

Solid, dependable, robust. They rarely set the pulse racing though you have to admire that they've been an ever-present on the big stage since we were kids. They'll be feeling nice and comfy at home this summer

The stats

Fifa ranking 19th Odds to win 8-1

World Cup finals record P85 W53 D15 L17 F176 A106

World Cup best Winners 1954, '74, '90

Last 12 matches W5 D3 L4

Group fixtures

Costa Rica June 9, Munich 5pm

Poland June 14, Dortmund 8pm

Ecuador June 20, Berlin 3pm

The country

On the psychiatrist's couch

"I took several centuries to pull myself together and establish my own identity. When I was young I was influenced by totally the wrong sort of people. I got into a lot of fights and I did some terrible things. I've calmed down since but it's not always easy when people whistle The Great Escape at you all the time."

What they eat

Sausages, of course. Germany is home to more than 150 varieties of wurst made from just about every part of an animal you can imagine - and some you'd probably rather not.

What they watch

Soap opera Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten (Good Times and Bad Times) regularly attracts 40% of the viewing share and helped launch the pop career of Jeanette Biedermann - the German Britney.

Anthem in brief

The Germans praise German wine, women and songs and vow to keep them safe and happy even if it means lining river banks with their arms linked.

Well I never

With 60,000 registered naturists and 160 "free body culture" clubs, Germany can justifiably claim to be the nudist capital of the world. Neanderthal man came from just outside Düsseldorf.
